Overview

The goal of this week is to discuss some basic definitions for diversity and start understanding the value of diversity. Note there are many different frameworks with which to understand diversity. The one presented in the Scientific American report is routed on the development of science, on the idea that creativity is needed for scientific development. There are other frameworks, we will see two more later in the semester.

Learning Objectives

By the end of this module, you should be able to:

  1. Explain why diversity matters, at least within the context of scientific discovery.
  2. Explain how diversity helps, again within this one context.

Action Items

Read

From the Scientific American Special Report: How Diversity Empowers Science and Innovation (Links to an external site.), September 16, 2014, Scientific American, read at least these two articles:

  1. How Diversity Makes Us Smarter (Links to an external site.) - local copy.
  2. 3 Myths Plus a Few Best Practices for Achieving Diversity (Links to an external site.) - local copy.

Activities

By Monday, January 25th, please respond to the following prompt. Do not write more than 1-2 paragraphs to answer these questions. You don't need to answer them all, just use the questions as guidelines for discussion.

  • What surprised you from the material presented in these two articles?
  • Do you agree with the ideas presented?
  • Do you disagree with something presented there?
  • What more would you like to know about the ideas presented?

In-class activity

  • Jam board
